title: Synthesis of urchin-like NiCo2S4 electrode materials based on a two-step hydrothermal method for high-capacitance supercapacitors
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,9587-9593
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00361F, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Jingyu Tian, Jingjia Zhang, Xiaofeng Li
The specific capacity of urchin-like NiCo2S2 is 1352 F g−1 at a current density of 1 A g−1. The NiCo2S4//AC ASC device provides high energy density at a power density of 2025 W kg−1. The capacitance retention of NCS-1.5//AC is 81.98% after 10 000 cycles of charging and discharging.
